A River Runs Through It is based on the true story of two fly fishing brothers, Norman and Paul, (Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer) whose Reverend father (Tom Skerritt) tries to teach them life’s lessons by way of Fly Fishing. Comedy and drama with sprinkles of just the right amount of romance and special effects. Once you become lost in this river of loving family, you'll want to go fly fishing as well.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts his adolescence through the lens of the ideals of agriculture and socialism that his family had supported. Childhood days spent on the farm, innocent boys’ love, his efforts to spread socialist ideals through youth literature, business collapse that led to grave poverty and countless difficulties…

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the cat, and the cat has to ask a local woman, who loves cats (Kelli Maroney), to help him fight the posse.
